intro: Disporum cantoniense var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered disporum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its foliage is often used in traditional Chinese medicine, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The varietal form, parviflorum, is distinguished by its smaller, more delicate flowers compared to the typical species.
